text: How can I accurately program an automated "click" on Windows?
I wrote a program to click on an application automatically at scheduled time using Win32, using MOUSE_DOWN and MOUSE_UP.
It usually works well, except I found that I need to put in a
(using Ruby, which allows sleeping a fraction of a second).
Without the sleep, sometimes the click doesn't go through.
But I noticed that sometimes, the click is "too long".
The click is actually on a Flash app's Right Arrow.
This right arrow will go to the next item on a list.
So if you MOUSE_DOWN for a little longer, it actually will shift 2 or 3 items instead of just 1 item.
So I wonder, is there a way to accurately simulate 1 click in this case.
Probably there is no MOUSE_CLICK event?
It has to be simulated using MOUSE_DOWN and MOUSE_UP?
(it is actually called MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTDOWN and MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTUP on Win32, just for simplicity it is stated as MOUSE_DOWN instead.
